transportAdvice: Cambridge is a compact, walkable city where most colleges, museums, and attractions are easily reached on foot or by bicycle, which is extremely popular among locals and visitors alike. A local bus network serves the wider city and surrounding areas, and taxis are readily available for longer journeys or late-night travel.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional frost, light rain is common and days are short.
Still cold with a mix of overcast skies and occasional crisp, clear days; frost remains possible.
Early spring brings gradually warming temperatures and longer days, though showers are still frequent.
Mild and pleasant with spring blossoms, though unpredictable showers can interrupt sunny spells.
Warm and increasingly sunny, one of the more enjoyable months to visit with lush green surroundings.
Warm early summer weather with long daylight hours; occasional thunderstorms are possible.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days, though brief showers can still occur.
Warm and generally pleasant, similar to July with a mix of sunshine and occasional rain.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings and a gradual increase in rainfall, but days remain mild.
Noticeably cooler with autumn foliage and more frequent overcast, rainy days.
Cold and damp with short days; fog can be common in the mornings across the flat Fenland landscape.
Cold and often wet with the possibility of frost; festive atmosphere in the city centre despite the chill.
